name: OUSSAMA ABOULMAHASSINE EL IDRISS
role: Master 2 Student in Biotechnology and Quality, Faculty of Sciences Ben M'Sik, Hassan II University of Casablanca
bio:
Master 2 student in Biotechnology and Quality at the Faculty of Sciences Ben M'Sik of Hassan II University of Casablanca, he is interested in quality, health safety, and the valorization of scientific research, with particular interest in integrated approaches linking human health, animal health, environment, and innovation.

He is a member of the organizing committee of the International Congress for Research, Innovation and Valorization (CIRIV'26), an international scientific event structured around the One Health concept. In this context, he contributes to scientific and logistical organization, document management, as well as scientific and digital communication of the congress, interacting with national and international researchers, experts, and speakers.

Simultaneously, he holds the position of Vice-President of the Ibn Khaldoun Club for Social and Cultural Action at the Faculty of Sciences Ben M'Sik, where he participates in the design, coordination, and implementation of social, cultural, and scientific initiatives promoting student engagement.

He has over five years of experience in digital marketing and professional community management.
